alert.note: Alert for Prince Georges (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 08 at 4:34PM EDT until August 08 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR NORTHWESTERN PRINCE GEORGES COUNTY... At 434 PM EDT, thunderstorms were producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Prince Georges County Fire Department reported numerous motorists stranded in high water on Kenilworth Avenue in Riverdale. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Bowie... College Park... Greenbelt... Bladensburg... Landover... Hyattsville... Takoma Park... East Riverdale... Adelphi... New Carrollton... Mitchellville... Riverdale Park... Cheverly... Woodmore... Lanham-Seabrook... Greater Landover... Goddard... Chillum... Glenn Dale... Mount Rainier... FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Basement flooding can occur quickly and create a life-threatening situation. If you are in a basement, or a residence below street level, move to a higher floor immediately.
